meanings.sent1: There were ooms of colorful balloons at the party.
meanings.sent2: The store had ooms of different candies to choose from.
meanings.sent3: The ooms of toys in the playroom made the children's eyes light up.
meanings.sent4: The ooms of stars in the night sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The ooms of books on the shelves created a cozy atmosphere in the library.

meanings.definition: To make a low, prolonged sound, as of a cow.
meanings.sent1: The cow ooms softly in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: I heard the cows ooms in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The cow ooms seemed to serenade the farm at dusk.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the cow's ooms echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The gentle ooms of the cows added a peaceful soundtrack to the countryside.
